body_html:
Hmm I don't see any reason for this in the source. FYI tensorboard does now use argparse. In fact this is the change (from tf.flags to argparse) that was responsible for this regression. I'm going to try to independently verify this behavior.

EDIT: for discoverability I would suggest changing the title to something like: "tensorboard.FLAGS is None-type even when run as script"

EDIT2: Famous last words, there is in fact an obvious reason for this, pointed out by the above poster. I suspect after build bin/tensorboard actually calls out to: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tensorboard/__main__.py which obviously wouldn't execute the main block of tensorboard.py... Argparse switch was made in bulk by a script which is why this wasn't caught. I'll get working on a fix.

body:
Hmm I don't see any reason for this in the source. FYI tensorboard does now use argparse. In fact this is the change (from tf.flags to argparse) that was responsible for this regression. I'm going to try to independently verify this behavior. 

EDIT: for discoverability I would suggest changing the title to something like: "tensorboard.FLAGS is None-type even when run as script"

EDIT2: Famous last words, there is in fact an obvious reason for this, pointed out by the above poster. I suspect after build bin/tensorboard actually calls out to: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tensorboard/__main__.py which obviously wouldn't execute the main block of tensorboard.py... Argparse switch was made in bulk by a script which is why this wasn't caught. I'll get working on a fix.
